Donald Rumsfeld takes direct aim at Colin Powell in recounting the former general's famous U.N. speech in February 2003, laying out the administration's case that Saddam Hussein indeed possessed a stockpile of banned weapons. Over time a narrative developed that Colin Powell was somehow innocently misled into making a false declaration to the Security Council and the world, Donald Rumsfeld writes.
